Package coe318.lab2

Class ComplexNumber

java.lang.Object
coe318.lab2.ComplexNumber
public class ComplexNumber
extends java.lang.Object
ComplexNumber models a complex number expressed in rectangular form (real and imaginary parts). It is an immutable object.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    ComplexNumber​(double re, double im)
    Construct a ComplexNumber given its real and imaginary parts.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    ComplexNumber add​(ComplexNumber z)
    Returns a new ComplexNumber that is the sum of this and z.
    ComplexNumber divide​(ComplexNumber z)
    Returns a new ComplexNumber that is this divided by z.
    double getImaginary()
    Returns the imaginary component.
    double getReal()
    Returns the real component.
    ComplexNumber multiply​(ComplexNumber z)
    Returns a new ComplexNumber that is the product of this and z.
    ComplexNumber negate()
    Returns a new ComplexNumber number that is the negative of this.
    ComplexNumber reciprocal()
    Returns a new ComplexNumber that is the reciprocal of this.
    ComplexNumber subtract​(ComplexNumber z)
    Returns a new ComplexNumber that is the difference of this and z.
    java.lang.String toString()
    Returns a String representation of this in the format:

      public ComplexNumber negate()
      Returns a new ComplexNumber number that is the negative of this. Note: the original ComplexNumber is NOT modified.
      Returns:
      -this

    • add

      public ComplexNumber add​(ComplexNumber z)
      Returns a new ComplexNumber that is the sum of this and z. Note: the original ComplexNumber is NOT modified.
      Parameters:
      z -
      Returns:
      this + z

    • subtract

      public ComplexNumber subtract​(ComplexNumber z)
      Returns a new ComplexNumber that is the difference of this and z. Note: the original ComplexNumber is NOT modified.
      Parameters:

      Returns:

    • multiply

      public ComplexNumber multiply​(ComplexNumber z)
      Returns a new ComplexNumber that is the product of this and z. Note: the original ComplexNumber is NOT modified.
      Parameters:
      z -
      Returns:
      this * z

    • reciprocal

      public ComplexNumber reciprocal()
      Returns a new ComplexNumber that is the reciprocal of this. Note: the original ComplexNumber is NOT modified.
      Returns:
      1.0 / this

    • divide

      public ComplexNumber divide​(ComplexNumber z)
      Returns a new ComplexNumber that is this divided by z. Note: the original ComplexNumber is NOT modified.
      Parameters:
      z -
      Returns:
      this / z

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a String representation of this in the format: 
       real +-(optional) i imaginary
      If the imaginary part is zero, only the real part is converted to a String. A "+" or "-" is placed between the real and imaginary parts depending on the the sign of the imagrinary part.

      Examples: 

       ..println(new ComplexNumber(0,0); -> "0.0"
 ..println(new ComplexNumber(1,1); -> "1.0 + i1.0"
 ..println(new ComplexNumber(1,-1); -> "1.0 - i1.0"
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      the String representation.
